channel.title: How much value does money really have?
channel.description:
Here's another topic I figure I'd have better input on via Moparisthebest, as moparscape doesn't consistently support any interesting replies.
This past weekend my friend and I bought 10 McChickens and 10 McDoubles when we knew we would have been fine with 1 of each. Later I think back on it and evaluate the value of money and how much it really means to us. I did it for the memory and fun.
My reply most concerning the subject on moparscape was: [quote="ollie123, post:22, topic:330828"]The sad truth is, money makes the world go round.[/quote]But, does the world need to go round in order to exist peacefully?
Money was developed in an early age to determine the value of items. I know I wont hit every key point in the matter, but say your a nomad wondering South America. You fish for a living while others farm. You want crops while they want fish. Back then it was based on bartering and trading. But how do you determine how many carrots equals a fish? And what if it's the middle of winter and you're unable to grow anything? Upon this crossroad, currency was established along with a universal value of all things. Trading irrelevant items became obsolete due to how different the circumstances for each item was. This is the only true established purpose of money, and without it we would resort back to some form of systematic trade, lowering ourselves to cavemen.
Now, you look at society's philosophy on the way it's distributed, how it's put on a pedestal, favored over all things. We've become tied down to material, no doubt. But, without a physical form a value for anything, I don't believe we'd be as far as we are in society today.
So, ITT, discuss how much you value cash? Could you go out of your way to buy a homeless person food? Buy something to use for only a day? Make an over-the-top donation to something?
Also, if you've done anything that you could consider a "waste of money", tell about it.
Discuss.

But, does the world need to go round in order to exist peacefully?

item.title: How much value does money really have?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

yakman:

what if the price of gold drops?

Stocks go up.

And when stocks are down gold goes up.

mwiebelhaus:

Put some money in gold, that way when US currency goes to shit you haven’t lost any money.

Our currency plays a major role in the worlds economy, if the dollar collapses the entire worlds economy will suffer. But either way it wont collapse, all economies fluctuate in currency value.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:24, topic:330897”][quote author=Frell link=topic=427268.msg3179809#msg3179809 date=1271202806]

Money does bring evil to the world due to greedy people and war over it and what not, but it also has great importance in surviving, if there weren’t money then how would there be order? Everyone could walk in anywhere because ‘You don’t have to pay for that!’ money is kind of balanced it brings good and bad to the world in my opinion. It is also better than trading goats…much easier to trade.

Agreed. I wont how there was order back in the medieval times…
[/quote]
because they currency then as well? currency isnt a recent invention its been around for thousands and thousands of years[/quote]
l2troll :P.

item.title: How much value does money really have?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

sanga282:

the significance is you are trading the value of the gold in your countries national reserve,

Not anymore. There aren’t that many currencies tied to gold anymore. Most currency’s exist purely on the basis of trade. The dollar exists because of oil, which means that the Federal Reserve can print as many dollars as they want.

Read full topic

item.title: How much value does money really have?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:13, topic:330897”]if you havent noticed all people want is money they wouldnt give anything unless they get paid only a few would survive all because every1 is so fucking greedy i think the world atm is fucked up and needs some new leaders and if you want proof of wat the greed is causing look at the third-world countries which cant afford to feed their people are dieing from starvation all cause the greedy people of america ect(i dont want to list every country) are eating od and dont know how to give to the others who acually need it![/quote]Once again, if money were eliminated it wouldn’t eliminate greed. It would only eliminate that form of greed. You truly believe that if we no longer had money a majority of the population of earth would forget how to survive? You’re insinuating that money is what keeps humanity alive, and without it a large portion of the world would be deprived of said nutrient and die.

On the topic of third-world countries, did it ever occur to you that they believe in such a way of living? Perhaps they expect to die from such causes, it’s happened so often that I wouldn’t doubt they’re used to it. Of course, you can try to pend our way of living to their people and assume they’re lives are miserable, but look at us? You said it yourself, our half of society runs on greed and material. Which is better? It’s a lose-lose outcome with what you’ve said.

Read full topic
item.source: How much value does money really have?
